channel.title: 647 Compiler?
channel.description: So any one have .bat compiler code for 647?

item.title: 647 Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

You need to import your source into Eclipse for it to function properly, not just copy and paste it in. There are plenty of guides around the Internet for importing a source into an IDE, so I will not show you.
Yes, change bin to src.

Read full topic

item.title: 647 Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:8, topic:517718”]You use your JDK to compile.
Regarding your issue with the file not found:

[ul][li]javac is the Java compiler, and it is telling you that it cannot find files with the .java extension. There are two possible solutions:[/li][list]
[li]You need to set your PATH and CLASSPATH variables to your current JDK and JRE versions.[/li]
[li]Your directories are still pointing to the wrong direction. Why are you pointing your compiler towards your bin folder? The bin folder holds your .class files, the src folder holds your .java files.[/li]
[/list][/ul][/quote]
How do i set the path and the classpath because all i did is just coping the source into eclipse (it might be the problem)
and should i change the bin into src?

And i really dont want to use eclipse i just want to compile using a file.

Read full topic

item.title: 647 Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

You use your JDK to compile.
Regarding your issue with the file not found:

[ul][li]javac is the Java compiler, and it is telling you that it cannot find files with the .java extension. There are two possible solutions:[/li][list]
[li]You need to set your PATH and CLASSPATH variables to your current JDK and JRE versions.[/li]
[li]Your directories are still pointing to the wrong direction. Why are you pointing your compiler towards your bin folder? The bin folder holds your .class files, the src folder holds your .java files.[/li]
[/list][/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: 647 Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I just want to compile what will i learn from a complier bat file? can you tell me what to do?
@echo off
title Compiler
“C:\files\javafolder\jdk?or?jre\bin\javac” *.java
pause
this is how its looks and when i try to compile
javac file not: *java

and no errors in one of the files in the IDE. but the java project have a “!” sign

Read full topic

item.title: 647 Compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Compilers aren’t base-specific. Look at other compiler batch files and adjust them to your directories.
Anyways you should be using an IDE to build your server.
